column4: Hi, can someone in the room give feedback my problem with black screen in recovery mode discussed above?  something is preventing me from entering commandline
does the livecd work, did you enable hardware drivers?
yes, I believe that's the problem... that i enabled a proprietary ati driver
what graphic card do you have?
checking, one moment
try rescue mode of the livecd to get a shell, or boot rescue mode with vga=normal nomodeset
you can do that by pressing e instead of enter in grub and adding vga=normal nomodeset to the kernel line
thanks for the tip.  trying those things now...

FYI: Problem solved by uninstalling ATI drivers (ATI Mobility Radion HD 3400 Series).  vga=normal nomodeset on installed copy did not work (didn't try liveCD but i assume the live CD would have worked).  Could only boot after first booting Windows XP.  After that I can boot Ubuntu once and before having to boot XP again.  thanks for your help.
you have to boot XP and restart before loading ubuntu works?
guess something is wrong with how the gfx card is initialized then
correct
its not unlogical then to not be able to reboot ubuntu
yeah, seems that way
well it has the same cause in any case, it occurs with the hardware drivers on and off?
